Support & Invest in Kurdish Education

HinbûnaKurdî is building the first dedicated Kurdish language learning app. No major platform — not Duolingo, not Babbel, not Rosetta Stone — offers Kurdish. We are changing that.

The Problem

  • 30–45 million Kurdish speakers worldwide
  • 1.5–2 million Kurds in Europe losing their language
  • Zero serious digital tools to learn Kurdish
  • A language without digital presence risks disappearing

The Solution

  • Complete Kurdish learning app: A1 to B2
  • Kurmanji first, Sorani and other dialects to follow
  • Built by a Kurdish teacher + senior engineer
  • Affordable pricing, ecosystem ready for more apps
I want to support I want to invest

The Mission

Why This Matters

This is not just a cultural project — it is a viable product in an empty market. The Kurdish diaspora is digitally connected, culturally invested, and waiting for this tool.

The Opportunity: Early supporters are not just donors — they are founding members of a movement. The Kurdish diaspora is digitally connected, culturally invested, and waiting for this tool.

How Your Money Is Used

App Development
Majority of budget
Full-time senior developer building the platform

Included in partnership

Servers & Infra
~€1,800 / year
AWS hosting, domain, GitHub, app store fees

~€3,000
UG registration, contracts, compliance
Marketing
~€3,000
Community outreach, app store optimization, social media
Emergency Buffer
€5,000
Unexpected costs, scaling needs

Founders Roadmap

Our Plan — Armanc & Mamoste

This is our personal guide. The real numbers, the real decisions, and the steps we need to take together. Everything here is between us.

Year 1 Funding Target €82,000
Inner Circle €15K–60K
Businesses €5K–20K
Institutions €10K–50K
Community €0–5K
Monthly Burn Rate — Where the Money Goes
Armanc Salary (net €3,500 + tax/insurance) €5,700/mo
Mamoste Salary €0 (Year 1)
Servers & Tools €150/mo
Marketing €250/mo
Legal & Setup (one-time) €3,000
Emergency Buffer €5,000

Armanc’s Red Line

Needs minimum €3,500 net/month to go full-time on the project.

Year 1 Roadmap

Month 1–2
Fundraising & Legal Setup
Armanc: Pitch deck, donor meetings, verify visa for self-employment. Still employed.
Mamoste: Begin organizing A1 content in structured format.
Month 3 — DECISION POINT
~€82K annual funding secured = Armanc goes full-time
The full gross annual need (~€82,000) must be secured or committed. If yes, Armanc submits resignation (1–3 months notice). Otherwise: continue as side project.
Go / No-Go
Month 3–5
Full-Time Development
Armanc: HTML mockups → real app. Auth, course engine, content CMS, payment system.
Mamoste: A1 content ready, A2 in progress. Loading into CMS.
Month 6–7
Beta Launch
Release to donor community (50–100 testers). App Store submission. Payment system live. First revenue starts.
Beta
Month 8–9
Public Launch
App live for everyone. ASO optimization. Community marketing push. B1 content loading.
Launch
Month 10 — EVALUATION POINT
Stay or Transition?
Evaluate Monthly Recurring Revenue (MRR) growth. Month 10 (not 12) because Armanc needs 2 months buffer to find a new job if needed. Berlin senior roles: 2–8 weeks hiring.
Critical Decision
Month 11–12
Scale or Transition
If staying: Optimize, scale, ecosystem planning, consider investors from strength.
If leaving: Transition period, job search begins. App becomes side project.

Month 10 Decision Framework

✅
Monthly Revenue → €3,500+
STAY. Product-market fit confirmed. Enter Year 2. Consider investor from strength position.
⚠️
Monthly Revenue growing but < €2,000
OPTION A: Seek investor for Year 2 runway.
OPTION B: Side project + job search.
❌
Monthly Revenue flat or declining
Transition out. Begin job search. App continues as side project for both.
Revenue Milestones — What We Need
Mamoste minimum wage ~350 subscribers • €2,500/mo
€2.5K
Both founders at minimum ~970 subscribers • €7,000/mo
€7K
Both at €3,500 net each ~1,940 subscribers • €14,000/mo
€14K
Comfortable + hiring possible ~3,470 subscribers • €25,000/mo
€25K

Revenue Split — 60 / 40

App revenue is always split 60% Mamoste / 40% Armanc. Mamoste’s minimum wage is guaranteed first — until his share covers minimum wage, he gets priority.

Until Mamoste reaches min. wage
Mamoste: Gets priority from revenue until minimum wage is covered
Armanc: Remainder
After minimum wage secured
Mamoste: 60%
Armanc: 40%
Action Items — What We Do Now

Review 3-year plan together — mark sections that need changes
Agree on revenue split model (60/40) or adjust

Decide: try EXIST grant or focus on community donations?
This Month
Armanc: Create pitch deck for Kurdish community donors
Armanc: Verify visa for self-employment with Ausländerbehörde
Armanc: List 10 potential donors with estimated amounts
Mamoste: Begin structuring A1 content into lessons/units
Both: Visit TU/HTW Gründungszentrum for free EXIST consultation
Next 2–3 Months
Meet top 5 donors face-to-face (not email)
Secure ~€82,000 in commitments (full Year 1 funding) before Armanc resigns
Register Nûcraft Labs UG (after EXIST check) — money must flow through legal entity
Submit grant applications (EU, Berlin, applicable programs)
Armanc submits resignation once ~€82K is secured/committed

Invest

Invest in the Future of Kurdish Digital Education

HinbûnaKurdî is more than a language app. Starting with Kurmanji, we will expand to Sorani and other Kurdish dialects. Beyond that, the platform can serve language schools, corporate training, and universities. The Kurdish app is Version 1. The platform is the real business.

Market Opportunity

  • 30–45 million Kurdish speakers, zero major competitors
  • 150K–300K diaspora heritage learners actively seeking tools
  • Growing Kurdistan Region with rising digital education demand
  • Platform designed for white-labeling across industries

Business Model

  • Subscription: €9.99/mo or €59.99/yr (Europe)
  • Freemium: free tier drives downloads, premium unlocks courses
  • B2B: institutional licenses for universities, organizations
  • Platform licensing: white-label for other learning providers

What Makes This Different

  • No competition — the market is completely open
  • Emotional market with deep cultural motivation
  • Platform play — works for any learning domain
  • Low burn rate, small team, fast execution

Revenue Projections (3-Year)

Year Scenario Paying Subscribers Annual Revenue
Year 1 Building + Launch 50 – 300 €5,000 – €25,000
Year 2 Growth 800 – 2,000 €80,000 – €200,000
Year 3 Scale 2,000 – 5,000+ €250,000 – €500,000+

These projections include app subscriptions only. Platform/B2B revenue is additional.

What We Are Looking For

  • Investment range: €50,000 – €150,000
  • In exchange for: 10–25% equity (negotiable)
  • Use of funds: dev acceleration, marketing, dialect expansion, team growth
  • When: after launch + traction (Month 9–12)

Risks — Honestly

Transparency builds trust. Here is what could go wrong and how we mitigate it.

Slow user adoption Medium

Large diaspora, no competition, community-driven launch via donors

Technical challenges Low

Senior developer with 12+ years experience, proven tech stack

Content quality Low

Qualified Kurdish teacher with years of teaching experience

Revenue below projections Medium

Lean cost structure, founders can sustain on lower revenue

Market too niche Low

30–45M speakers is not niche. Platform vision expands beyond Kurdish.

Competitor enters market Low

First-mover advantage + community loyalty. A competitor validates the market.

  • Platform designed for reuse: white-label capability

FAQ

Common Questions

Directly to building the app: development, hosting, content creation, and launch. We publish transparent updates on spending.
Depends on the legal structure. Business sponsorships may qualify for tax deduction. We provide proper receipts (Spendenquittung) where applicable.
Founding Partners (€5,000+) can opt for a conditional repayment agreement: if the app reaches specific revenue targets within 3 years, your contribution is returned from profits.
Beta launch is targeted for Month 6–7 after development begins. Public launch at Month 8–9. Supporters get early access.
All supporters receive progress updates. Founding Partners and institutions receive quarterly reports. We operate through a registered German company (UG) with proper accounting.
We approach investors after launch, not before. By the time you invest, you will see a working product, real users, and growth metrics. Early expressions of interest are welcome.
The technology operates under Nûcraft Labs UG (haftungsbeschränkt), a registered German company. Investment terms are formalized through a proper contract with legal counsel.
The platform technology has value beyond Kurdish. White-label licensing for other industries is the backup revenue path. The founding team's expertise retains market value regardless.
Exit scenarios include: acquisition by a larger EdTech company, revenue-based buyback, or continued profit-sharing. Specific terms are negotiated per investment agreement.
For amounts under €10,000, consider the Founding Partner support tier which offers conditional repayment. Formal equity investment starts at €50,000.
